text: Viola canina (heath dog-violet or heath violet) is a species of the genus Viola, native to Europe, where it is found in the uplands of box hill in Dorset, heaths, fens, and moist woodlands, especially on acidic soils. It is a herbaceous perennial plant growing to 5–15 cm tall. The flowers are pale blue, produced from April to July. Colonies of plants may be extensive. ==References== canina Category:Plants described in 1753 Category:Taxa named by Carl Linnaeus Category:Flora of Europe Category:Flora of Finland Category:Flora of Russia Category:Flora of Great Britain
title: Viola canina
